page.title: 13OLD HOUSES IN DUNDONALD AREA
page.content: There are several different types of houses in and around the village of Dundonald. The oldest of the houses in the village are in the Main Street and in Tarbolton Road. One of them was built around 1720. Another was the old Toll House where people had to pay when entering the village. In the garden of this house can be seen the remains of the old weigh_bridge. These old houses are of historical interest and their appearance cannot be changed outside, though most have been modernised inside. Many of the farms around the village too are very old. Dankeith Farm, for example, was originally the stables for Dankeith House. During the war members of the RAF lived there and after that, monks worked the farm. The present owner took over in 1967.
